thread.title: DeMarcus Ware out vs. Browns? Broncos brace for possibility
thread.title_full: DeMarcus Ware out vs. Browns? Broncos brace for possibility - The Denver Post

author: Nicki Jhabvala
title: DeMarcus Ware out vs. Browns? Broncos brace for possibility
text:
The prospect of the Broncos playing without outside linebacker DeMarcus Ware on Sunday in Cleveland because of a back injury has grown increasingly likely.
Ware suffered back spasms in the first half Sunday and did not participate in practice Wednesday.
"We're in a day-to-day process," coach Gary Kubiak said after practice. "I know there are a lot of reports out there, but I can tell you this, he looked really good today. We're going to do right by him, but today he's doing pretty darn good."
Kubiak added that the Broncos' schedule could factor into the decision on Ware. They have a bye week after this weekend's game at Cleveland, which would give Ware two weeks of rest if he sits.
"I'm just going to do what Greek (head trainer Steve Antonopulos) and the trainers tell me," Ware said. "The plane ride home was real, though."
Teammates have braced for the possibility that he might miss Sunday's game, but are confident in their depth at linebacker. Backups Shaquil Barrett and Shane Ray filled in during the second half at Oakland and recorded a sack apiece and combined for five tackles and two quarterback hits.
"We expect big things out of Shane and Shaq to be able to step up," cornerback Chris Harris said Monday. "We feel like they can get the job done."
Nicki Jhabvala: njhabvala@denverpost.com or @NickiJhabvala
